image_1.description: LANI is a benchmark for instruction following, specifically a navigation task used to evaluate the model's performance.
image_1.reason: The image on the left depicts an outdoor scene with a well and a cactus, which aligns with the navigation task described in the text. The instructions provided also correspond to a navigation task, making LANI the most appropriate match.

image_2.description: LINGUNET is an architecture inspired by the U-NET image generation method, used for generating a probability distribution over pixels in a feature map based on natural language instructions.
image_2.reason: The image clearly shows the architecture of LINGUNET, which processes natural language instructions and panoramic images to predict goal locations and generate actions. The diagram includes components such as text kernels, feature maps, and an RNN for action generation, all of which are consistent with the description of LINGUNET in the text.

image_4.description: LANI is an event or task designed to evaluate an agent's ability to follow navigation instructions in an environment with landmarks.

The presence of a drone icon at the start of the path indicates the starting position of the agent, and the overall setup matches the LANI task described in the text.

image_8.entity_name: Table 3: Performance on the development data.
image_8.description: The table compares the performance of different methods on two datasets, LANI and CHAI. Each dataset has four metrics: SD (Success Distance), TC (Time to Completion), SD (Success Distance), and MA (Mean Accuracy). The methods evaluated include STOP, RANDOMWALK, MOSTFREQUENT, MISRA17, CHAPLOT18, and Our Approach (OA).

image_11.description: A process used to assess the performance of approaches by comparing generated paths with instructions on a Likert scale.

image_12.description: Goal prediction is an event in the CHAI corpus where an additional RNN predicts the sequence of intermediate goals given the instruction only.
